abstract: More thoughts on map apps, including a radical suggestion.

snippet: Apple is widely expected to introduce a smaller, cheaper version of its iPad on Tuesday, perhaps in response to the crop of seven-inch tablets that have emerged from competitors in the last year. But how are those tablets doing anyway?
abstract: Apple is widely expected to introduce a smaller, cheaper version of its iPad on Tuesday, perhaps in response to the crop of seven-inch tablets that have emerged from competitors in the last year. But how are those tablets doing anyway?

snippet: Greg Smith's book offered few details on Goldman. | Rajat K. Gupta's lawyers pushed for leniency. | N.Y.U. Law announced an overhaul. | Vikram Pandit stepped down after Citi's chairman stepped up. | Andrew Ross Sorkin said nowadays, Wall St. savio...
abstract: Greg Smith's book offered few details on Goldman. | Rajat K. Gupta's lawyers pushed for leniency. | N.Y.U. Law announced an overhaul. | Vikram Pandit stepped down after Citi's chairman stepped up. | Andrew Ross Sorkin said nowadays, Wall St. saviors may wish they weren't.

headline.main: Week in Review: Ex-Goldman Trader's Book Is Short on Details

snippet: A collection of links from the reporters and editors of the Dining section.
abstract: A collection of links from the reporters and editors of the Dining section.

snippet: Investors were spooked on Friday by a growing number of pessimistic reports from corporate executives.
abstract: Growing number of downbeat financial announcements from American companies--including General Electric, McDonald's, Google and Microsoft--generates worst stock sell-off in nearly four months; downward trading occurs at an orderly pace, at least resisting the panic of previous sell-offs.

headline.main: Shares Fall as Earnings Disappoint on Wall St.
headline.print_headline: Shares Fall As Earnings Disappoint On Wall St.

snippet: The latest version of Mac OS X offers several ways to share Web pages by e-mail.
abstract: The latest version of Mac OS X offers several ways to share Web pages by e-mail.

headline.main: Q&A: Mailing Web Links with Mac Mail

snippet: Just four months after a much-hyped introduction, the video chat company has laid off employees and is tweaking its features.
abstract: Airtime, video chat site created by Napster veterans Sean Parker and Shawn Fanning, has lost important employees and laid off others only four months after its much-hyped introduction; story reflects the challenges for any start-up, regardless of pedigree, in winning over users when so many other sites, apps and services are vying for their attention.

headline.main: Airtime, a Pedigreed Start-Up, Is Tested

snippet: The Court of Appeal in Britain backed a judgment that the Samsung Galaxy tablet computer was “not as cool” as the Apple iPad, and therefore did not infringe on Apple’s rights.
abstract: Court of Appeal in Britain backs a judgment that the Samsung Galaxy tablet computer is 'not as cool' as the Apple iPad, and therefore does not infringe on Apple’s rights.

headline.main: Apple Loses Copyright Appeal Against Samsung in Britain
headline.print_headline: Apple Loses Copyright Appeal Against Samsung in Britain

snippet: Google’s quarterly results, released early by mistake, reflected losses at Motorola Mobility and plummeting prices for clicks on ads.
abstract: Google shares plummet by more than 9 percent after the company releases a disappointing earnings report, spurring Nasdaq to halt trading in its shares in the early afternoon; company reported third-quarter net income of $2.18 billion, down from $2.73 billion a year ago, reflecting a reduction in the price advertisers pay per click on ads.

headline.main: Shares Fall Sharply as Google Earnings Are Released Early
headline.print_headline: Google Shares Fall on Disappointing Earnings
